TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> No to just about all of them. People would wonder if we were using our access to rig them and stuff like that, and also we sometimes help pick the winners.
> 

I wondered why I never see you or any of the others doing challenges. 

And truth is, this is also the big reason I don't want to be a moderator (not that I was ever in the running). I am so proud of how many people have read Emiko, I'd hate to have someone accuse me of jacking up the view count. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, Badie said:
> 
> 
> That´s bad ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") we can make a special challenge for moderators ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 

Well, we did get some nice little presents that time. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I have 3 extra signed photographs of astronaut Scott Altman, and I was wondering if I could give it out as a challenge prize. I've done this on other forums, and I have not found anything in the rules of this forum that are against it, but I just wanted to check in with you guys.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Lo Var Lachland said:
> 
> 
> I have 3 extra signed photographs of astronaut Scott Altman, and I was wondering if I could give it out as a challenge prize. I've done this on other forums, and I have not found anything in the rules of this forum that are against it, but I just wanted to check in with you guys.
> 

The person to ask would be [@Badie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/149302-badie/) , but with the disruption in Mexico City, you may not get a response right away.

>

Yeah, I bet. that's alright. I'm just wondering. I'm in no rush. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Of course we can make a special challenge to give those signed photographs. Please send me a PM ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Are there new changes to the forum code? The Forums now only work on Microsoft Edge. Chrome and Firefox no longer work. When using those I can't post, reply or quote. I can only browse and respond to PMs.

> 
> 
> 30 minutes ago, akron said:
> 
> 
> Are there new changes to the forum code? The Forums now only work on Microsoft Edge. Chrome and Firefox no longer work. When using those I can't post, reply or quote. I can only browse and respond to PMs.
> 

Working fine for me in Firefox 55 on both Windows and Linux.

However, lately I've been running into more and more websites that have to be run in a private window in order to work on FF in Windows.   I've resorted to running in permanent private mode.  Maybe try the forum in a private tab or window and see if it makes a difference.  Never been an issue on Linux though..

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Geonovast said:
> 
> 
> Working fine for me in Firefox 55 on both Windows and Linux.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> However, lately I've been running into more and more websites that have to be run in a private window in order to work on FF in Windows.   I've resorted to running in permanent private mode.  Maybe try the forum in a private tab or window and see if it makes a difference.  Never been an issue on Linux though..
> 

Thanks, I've just tried it and unfortunately, it does not work for me.

By the way. I tried it on 3 different computers at 2 different locations. I freshly installed Opera and it also does not work

EDIT: One more symptom. If I "Edit" a post on FF or Chrome, the post I am editing will appear blank. So will any quote boxes in that post

**Edited <time datetime="2017-09-22T15:29:46Z" title="09/22/2017 03:29  PM" data-short="6 yr">September 22, 2017</time> by akron**

Sounds very strange, [@akron](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/116554-akron/). No problems here on either Firefox or Comodo Dragon (a version of Chromium), and no problems on Chrome on mobile/tablet, either. Sorry for the obvious question but when did you last restart your device?
I use Chrome and have had no problems.

I've tried a number of things and nothing works. Oh well, hopefully someone else can chime in if they have this problem.

One more symptom: If I click "Insert other media" it jumps me to the top of the page and a black rectangle saying "loading" appears but the circle thing doesn't move or goes away.

EDIT: I've re-installed browsers and installed new ones I'd never used. Can a moderator PM me to help?

I am informed that this rule is no longer in effect.
I'm just asking how you can sticky/pin a topic. Do you need a moderator to do it?
moderators only, usually for TOTMs, subforum rules, announcements, general stuff like that
Yes, only mods wield that power. Only for very important stuff or TOTM stuff, as mentioned above.
Yes, it's a moderator thing.
TOTM? What does that stand for. Thread Of The Moment?
